snippet: Just days before Greg Smith publicly criticized Goldman Sachs, a bill removing safeguards for investors sailed through the House. It is now on the floor of the Senate.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column points out that, just preceding Greg Smith's public resignation from and critique of Goldman Sachs, the JOBS bill sailed through the House, and is now in the Senate; notes that bill rolls back decades of regulation and rules aimed at preventing brokers and underwriters from ripping off customers; contends if the bill passes, investors will have less protection than they do now.
lead_paragraph: Just days before Greg Smith publicly criticized Goldman Sachs, a bill removing safeguards for investors sailed through the House. It is now on the floor of the Senate.

headline.print_headline: Paving Path To Fraud On Wall St.
headline.seo: The Return of the ‘Rip-Off Factor’ on Wall Street
headline.main: Paving Path to Fraud on Wall St.
